properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 28 at 9:05AM CST by NWS Huntsville AL
properties.description:
Locally Dense Freezing Fog will continue to impact much of southern
Middle Tennessee this morning. Visibilities will be reduced to one
quarter of a mile or less, and due to subfreezing temperatures, a
thin glaze of ice may develop on elevated surfaces such as cars,
bridges and overpasses.

Motorists are urged to drive with extreme caution, as visibilities
will vary significantly. Use low beams, reduce driving speed, and
allow for plenty of room between you and other cars.

The fog should dissipate between 11 AM and Noon CST.

Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio, or a favorite local media outlet,
for further statements or updates from the National Weather Service
in Huntsville.

NWSheadline: Significant Weather Advisory for Locally Dense Freezing Fog across southern middle Tennessee
